channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024040073
item.description:
Report X-2024040073

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-05T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND WITH A STRONG ODOR COMING FROM IT, WHEN RESPONDER OPENED THE BOX, SAW THERE WAS LIQUID LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE THEN NOTICED THE UN # ON THE BOX AND THAT THE BOX DIDN'T HAVE A LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND ON IT. UNDECLARED HAZMAT DISCOVERED.

item.title: Report E-2024040001
item.description:
Report E-2024040001

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-03T15:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-24
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 24, 2024, one (1) 2.2-liter jug of nitric acid was crushed in transit and released approximately sixteen (!6) ounces of product to adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed absorbent pads and neutralizer to the nitric acid-impacted pallet and cardboard. All spent cardboard, pallet, absorbent pads and shrink wrap were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. An additional 55-gallon drum was used to over pack the damaged 2.2-liter jug. Both were set aside for terminal disposal.

  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XLF. It was reported that 1 gallon of Reed Diffuser oil was released from one 25-gallon DF due to puncture. The release impacted the trailer floor.
